history.content: I took CS70 in summer and it was a nice experience. Personally, I think the curve in summer is pretty good compared to normal semesters. I don't think 61C and EE16B necessarily help with CS70 (definitely not 61C, but 16B might build your mathematical maturity). Taking CS70 in summer works very well for me because I got to focus on this single subject just like you mentioned. However, I've seen most of the topics before, so I didn't feel like the class went too fast. Most of my friends told me that they felt like although they got fairly good grades in the class they didn't have time to digest the material and they would like to take it over a longer period of time.

children.subject: 70 over the summer is great! Curve is exactly the same as in the regular semesters (they follow EECS grading guidelines), and you have more time to study since it’s the only class. Contrary to the student answer, I felt like I had a lot of time to absorb and appreciate the material which helped me do well on the exams. Find yourself a good study group, it helps a whole lot more than you may think!

Declarations don’t get processed until 3-4 weeks into the Fall semester. In our case, there was an unexpected delay which made the declaration even longer. Basically, you are not guaranteed to get into any upper divs the following semester like you are if you are declared. But if you Phase I 170 and 188 there’s a high chance you can get off the waitlist. I know some people who got off the waitlist in Phase II as well

OP here. Thank you so much for your responses! I was wondering if any of you were able to easily enroll in cs upper divs right after declaring in summer or was it hard to get into classes such as 170 and 188, if you were in that situation?

history.content:
I'm an intended LSCS student. I'm taking CS61B this semester and after this I need CS70 in order to declare. I was wondering if it's recommended to take 70 over the summer rather than taking it next semester?

I'd like to take it over summer because my brother is also planning to take it over summer and also since I'l only have 1-2 classes and have more time, I'll be able to focus more on 70. However, I'm afraid that if I take it in the summer, I won't be able to enroll in CS upper div classes for Fall '18 such as 170 and 188 since my declarations will go through earliest at the end of summer. Is this a valid concern?

If I don't take 70 next semester, I'll be taking 61C and EE16B instead. Are these potentially good prep courses for 70?
history.subject: CS70 over the Summer or in the Spring
